original: bod skad du /

translated: In Tibetan:

analyzed: lnga bcu pa'i bshad pa /

original: dpal ldan 'jig rten dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'jig rten dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Lokeśvara.

original: gang gi skye ba la sogs 'gro rnams sdug bsngal mtha' dag 'di yis dang por bcom //
analyzed: gang gi skye ba la sogs 'gro rnams sdug bsngal mtha' dag 'di yis dang por bcom //
translated: This [mantra] first conquers all the sufferings of beings' births and so forth.

original: slar yang di ring de bzhin ma 'ongs rab gsal 'khor lo gsum la khyab gyur pa //
analyzed: slar yang di ring de bzhin ma 'ongs rab gsal 'khor lo gsum la khyab gyur pa //
translated: Again, today and in the future, it pervades the three wheels.

original: shes rab padmar shar bas lhan cig skyes pa'i gda' ba rab tu gsal gyur pa'i //
analyzed: shes rab padmar shar bas lhan cig skyes pa'i gda' ba rab tu gsal gyur pa'i //
translated: Arisen in the lotus of wisdom, it illuminates the innate joy.

original: dri med 'jig rten mgon la phyag 'tshal nas ni lnga bcu ba ni rab bshad bya //
analyzed: dri med 'jig rten mgon la phyag 'tshal nas ni lnga bcu ba ni rab bshad bya //
translated: Having paid homage to the stainless Lokanātha, I will explain the Fifty.

original: de nas 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i de nas zhes pa'i sgra ni gzhung rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i de nas zhes pa'i sgra ni gzhung rtsom pa ste /
translated: Then, the word then in then this and so forth refers to the composition of the treatise.

original: de'i mthar zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mthar zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as at the end of that.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ngo bo'i sngags rab tu bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ngo bo'i sngags rab tu bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel lo //
translated: This is connected to the explanation of the mantra that is the essence of the explicable Lokeśvara.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa ni sngags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa ni sngags so //
translated: Likewise, the aspect is the mantra.

original: mchog tu zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: mchog tu zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Supreme means the nature of ultimate truth.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of nondual wisdom.

original: de bzhin du gsang ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, secret means it is not the domain of experience of śrāvakas and so on.

original: 'jig rten yang dag rmongs zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa ni mu stegs pa rnams so //🔽de rnams yang dag rmongs pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i sems med par byed pa de /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang dag rmongs zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa ni mu stegs pa rnams so // de rnams yang dag rmongs pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i sems med par byed pa de /
translated: The world is deluded means the world is the tīrthikas.🔽They are deluded because their minds are made to be without self-entity.

original: de'i phyir yang gang dag rmongs par 'gyur ba ni de'i sems par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gang dag rmongs par 'gyur ba ni de'i sems par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are deluded because their minds are made to be without self-entity.

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba ste /
translated: Supreme means excellent.

original: de'i phyir yang dag rmongs pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir rigs dang rigs byung mngon brjod pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir kang las mu stegs pa'i grub mtha'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag rmongs pa'o // gang gi phyir rigs dang rigs byung mngon brjod pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir kang las mu stegs pa'i grub mtha'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is deluded.

original: rigs dang rigs las byung ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rigs dang rigs las byung ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: Since the statement “the family and those arisen from the family” will be explained, the family and those arisen from the family are posited as the tenets of the tīrthikas.

original: de'i phyir mu stegs byed rnams kyis de'i lugs kyis de bzhin du gdul byar gyur pa sna tshogs pa'i gdul bya gdul ba'i lugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis /🔽yang dag @182a * //🔽pa'i bzhed pas so zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs byed rnams kyis de'i lugs kyis de bzhin du gdul byar gyur pa sna tshogs pa'i gdul bya gdul ba'i lugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis / yang dag @182a * // pa'i bzhed pas so zhes so //
translated: Therefore, the various systems of the tirthikas are the systems of the Tathagatas for the sake of disciplining the various disciples who are to be disciplined.🔽🔽The Tathagatas have the correct intention.🔽🔽

original: de'i phyir gang las mu stegs pa rnams rigs dang rigs las byung ba'i sgra thos nas de las 'dir bcom ldan 'das la dad pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las mu stegs pa rnams rigs dang rigs las byung ba'i sgra thos nas de las 'dir bcom ldan 'das la dad pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, the tirthikas, having heard the terms “family” and “one arisen from a family,” will generate faith in the Bhagavat.

original: dad pa las man ngag la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa las man ngag la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: From faith, they will enter into the precepts.

original: bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par yongs su shes nas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' log par lta ba yongs su spangs te yang dag pa'i tshul /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par yongs su shes nas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' log par lta ba yongs su spangs te yang dag pa'i tshul /
translated: Having understood the greatness of the self, they will abandon their false views and their own tenets.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i lam la rab tu zhugs par gyur nas byang chub chen po'i tshogs sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i lam la rab tu zhugs par gyur nas byang chub chen po'i tshogs sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: They will enter the path of the Sugata and will accumulate the collections for great enlightenment.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba'i thabs so //
translated: This is the method of the Bhagavat for subduing them.

original: de'i phyir / rigs dang rigs byung mngon brjod pas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rigs dang rigs byung mngon brjod pas //
translated: the mantra is explained by the expression of the family and the one arisen from the family.

original: 'jig rten yang dag rmongs pa nyid ni sngags te /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang dag rmongs pa nyid ni sngags te /
translated: The world is deluded by the mantra,

original: rigs kyi 'jig rten mgon po'i ngo bo nyid kyis bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi 'jig rten mgon po'i ngo bo nyid kyis bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: which should be explained by the nature of the family and the world-protector. This is the connection.

original: 'di ni drang ba'i don no //
analyzed: 'di ni drang ba'i don no //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning.

original: da ni nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the definitive meaning will be stated.

original: sngags ni mantra zhes pa ste skyob par 'gyur ba'i phyir mantra zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sngags ni mantra zhes pa ste skyob par 'gyur ba'i phyir mantra zhes brjod do //
translated: The mantra is man-tra, because it is a protector.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ni sngags so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ni sngags so //
translated: The mantra is the bindu of the mind of enlightenment, the nature of the innate joy.

original: rab bshad bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab bshad bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is the actualization.

original: de'i phyir yang na thig le lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang na thig le lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo /
translated: Therefore, the bindu is the nature of the innate.

original: aa tha'i aa yig bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab ste /
analyzed: aa tha'i aa yig bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab ste /
translated: The letter a of the word atha is the Bhagavatī Prajñā.

original: de'i phyir phul du byung ba'i shes pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir phul du byung ba'i shes pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: Therefore, the supreme consciousness is prajñā.

original: shes rab 'di yang phul du byung ba'i ye shes bdag med pa'i ngo bo rang bzhin med pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab 'di yang phul du byung ba'i ye shes bdag med pa'i ngo bo rang bzhin med pa zhes bshad do //
translated: This wisdom is also the supreme wisdom, explained as the nature of selflessness, the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: yang na aa'i yi ge chos thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na aa'i yi ge chos thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the letter A is called the door of all phenomena.

original: tha yig ni bcom ldan 'das nyid de thabs so //
analyzed: tha yig ni bcom ldan 'das nyid de thabs so //
translated: The letter Tha is the Bhagavān himself, the method.

original: ci'i phyir gsungs na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsungs na /
translated: Why is it said?

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: thig le khu ba'i tshul gyis thabs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: thig le khu ba'i tshul gyis thabs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The drop is the nature of the method in the manner of semen.

original: 'dir yang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir yang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Here, coemergent bliss is the nature of wisdom.

original: 'di ni zhes pa'i aa yig ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa'i aa yig ni dbang phyug go //
translated: The letter A of “this” is Īśvara.

original: dam pa ai dam zhes pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: dam pa ai dam zhes pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid dbang phyug ste /
translated: “Īḍā” is the characteristic of perfect complete enlightenment, Īśvara.

original: dam pa ni ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ni ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Īḍā” is because it bestows.

original: ai dam ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: ai dam ni 'di na'o //
translated: “Īḍā” is “here.”

original: par ma zhes pa'i pam ni padma /
analyzed: par ma zhes pa'i pam ni padma /
translated: The letter Pa of “param” is the lotus.

original: de las rtse bar byed de /
analyzed: de las rtse bar byed de /
translated: One plays in that.

original: ra mi kra d'a yam zhes pa'i khams las shes rab kyi chos 'byung du rol pa'o //
analyzed: ra mi kra d'a yam zhes pa'i khams las shes rab kyi chos 'byung du rol pa'o //
translated: In the wisdom-element-source, he sports as the syllable RAM.

original: de'i phyir gsang ba ni gsang ba'i 'khor lo la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsang ba ni gsang ba'i 'khor lo la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the secret is located in the secret wheel.

original: 'jig rten yang dag rmongs pa zhes pa'i @182b 'jig rten gyi sgra ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten yang dag rmongs pa zhes pa'i @182b 'jig rten gyi sgra ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The world is the sense-faculties, which are called “world” in the expression “delusion of the world.”

original: de rnams yang dag par rmongs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba thob pa'i mthar dbang po rnams 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams yang dag par rmongs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba thob pa'i mthar dbang po rnams 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are deluded because the sense-faculties cease at the end of attaining innate bliss.

original: mchog ces pa ni rab tu'o //
analyzed: mchog ces pa ni rab tu'o //
translated: Supreme means “excellent.”

original: rigs dang rigs byung mngon brjod pas rigs kyi sgras 'byung ba chen po lngar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rigs dang rigs byung mngon brjod pas rigs kyi sgras 'byung ba chen po lngar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The expression “family and family-born” is the five great elements, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir rigs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir rigs las byung ba'o //
translated: Because they arise from that, they are family-born.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje dang padma sbyar ba las sra bar gyur pa'i sra ba ni sa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje dang padma sbyar ba las sra bar gyur pa'i sra ba ni sa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the solidity that arises from the union of the vajra and lotus is the nature of earth, which is Vairochana.

original: de'i rjes su byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa de yang khu ba'i ngo bo nyid chu'i khams kyi ngo bo mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid do ;
analyzed: de'i rjes su byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa de yang khu ba'i ngo bo nyid chu'i khams kyi ngo bo mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo nyid do ;
translated: After that, the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment is the essence of semen, the essence of the water element, the essence of Akshobhya.

original: / rdo rje dang padma gnyis po yang dag par sbyar ba las me skye bar 'gyur te chags pa'i me las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje dang padma gnyis po yang dag par sbyar ba las me skye bar 'gyur te chags pa'i me las skyes pa'o //
translated: From the union of the vajra and lotus, fire is generated, born from the fire of passion.

original: de yang 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: And that is the essence of Amitabha.

original: de nas shes rab kyi chos 'byung du byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'bab pa de ni rlung gi dbang las so //
analyzed: de nas shes rab kyi chos 'byung du byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'bab pa de ni rlung gi dbang las so //
translated: Then, the descent of the Thought of Enlightenment into the lotus of wisdom is due to the power of wind.

original: rlung yang don yod grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rlung yang don yod grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: And wind is the essence of Amoghasiddhi.

original: de nas yang shin tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid chags pa yang dag par skyes pa'i bde ba la chags pa ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid de //
analyzed: de nas yang shin tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid chags pa yang dag par skyes pa'i bde ba la chags pa ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid de //
translated: Then, the attachment to the bliss of the passion that is the characteristic of the joy of supreme joy is the essence of space.

original: de yang rin chen dbang po'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rin chen dbang po'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: And that is the essence of Ratnasambhava.

original: de nyid 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the five great elements become the Tathagatas.

original: de'i rigs mngon par brjod pa'i sgras rigs kyi 'jig rten mgon po'i ngo bo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs mngon par brjod pa'i sgras rigs kyi 'jig rten mgon po'i ngo bo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin bshad par bya'o //
translated: The expression of that family is to be explained as the nature of the innate joy, the essence of the Lokesvara of the family.

original: dam tshig spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The pledge conduct, etc. The pledge is the pledge seal.

original: de yis lhan cig spyod pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yis lhan cig spyod pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The conduct with that is the union.

original: de rnams dang nges par bral ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams dang nges par bral ba ste /
translated: Those are definitely free from those.

original: 'dir dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Here, the pledge seal is the nature of the relative.

original: 'dir don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phyag rgya chen mo de nyid gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phyag rgya chen mo de nyid gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the nature of the ultimate truth is the great seal, because of the apprehension of that reality.

original: bya ba dus zhes pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni byed pa po dang / dus ni dus tshod de dag las rnam par grol ba nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba dus zhes pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni byed pa po dang / dus ni dus tshod de dag las rnam par grol ba nyid ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The action time, etc. The action is the agent, and the time is the occasion. Freedom from those is the ultimate truth.

original: de nyid gsum ldan yang dag lha //
analyzed: de nyid gsum ldan yang dag lha //
translated: The deity who is endowed with the three realities.

original: zhes pa'i de nyid gsum ni sngags kyi de nyid dang / bdag gi de nyid dang / lha'i de nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i de nyid gsum ni sngags kyi de nyid dang / bdag gi de nyid dang / lha'i de nyid de /
translated: The three realities are the reality of mantra, the reality of the self, and the reality of the deity.

original: de rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa'i lha ni rtsa'i 'khor lo thams cad du thig le rol pa ste /🔽de bu kri d'a yam zhes pa'i khams las 'jig rten dbang @183a * //
analyzed: de rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa'i lha ni rtsa'i 'khor lo thams cad du thig le rol pa ste / de bu kri d'a yam zhes pa'i khams las 'jig rten dbang @183a * //
translated: The deity who is endowed with those is the play of the drop in all the channel-wheels.

original: po rnams la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: po rnams la khyab pa'o //
translated: The word “lord” in the line “the lord of the world” is derived from the root dā, to pervade, and the element kṛt.

original: mgon ni 'jig rten mgon no //
analyzed: mgon ni 'jig rten mgon no //
translated: The “protector” is the lord of the world.

original: 'gro ba ni lus ngag yid kyi ngo bo nyid dbang du byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni lus ngag yid kyi ngo bo nyid dbang du byed pa ste /
translated: The “world” is the body, speech, and mind, which are brought under control.

original: bdag po ni 'gro ba'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: bdag po ni 'gro ba'i bdag po'o //
translated: The “lord” is the lord of the world.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dod pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'dod pa rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The “lord of desire” and so forth are the five objects of form and so on, which are pervaded by the nature of the Tathāgata.

original: dbang phyug ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba dam par byed pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba dam par byed pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i lha'o //
translated: The Lord is the god of desire, because he makes the highest bliss by the nature of innate joy.

original: mthong dang ma mthong 'bras rab ster //
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong 'bras rab ster //
translated: The result is given, seen and unseen.

original: zhes pa'i mthong ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthong ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The seen is the result of this.

original: ma mthong ba ni 'jig rten pha rol te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni 'jig rten pha rol te /
translated: The unseen is the other world.

original: gnyis ka'i 'bras bu rab tu ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i 'bras bu rab tu ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of both is given.

original: de'i bdag po ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de'i bdag po ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Lord is the Blessed One.

original: sngags ni bla ma'i zhal la gnas //
analyzed: sngags ni bla ma'i zhal la gnas //
translated: The mantra is in the guru's mouth.

original: zhes pa ni bla ma'i zhal las blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bla ma'i zhal las blang bar bya ste /
translated: This is to be taken from the guru's mouth.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid de po ti la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid de po ti la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nature of innate joy is not the domain of books, etc.

original: bla ma'i zhal las blang bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal las blang bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is to be taken from the guru's mouth.

original: da ni sngags rab tu bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sngags rab tu bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the mantra is to be explained:

original: drag chen zhes pa la sogs pa'i drag chen gyi sgras ha yig tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: drag chen zhes pa la sogs pa'i drag chen gyi sgras ha yig tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: The word great fierce is to be expressed as the syllable ha.

analyzed: phyi nas de yang gtum mo yis //

translated: The external sign is the thirty-two excellent marks and the eighty excellent minor marks of the nirmāṇacakra purified in the heart.

analyzed: gi rang bzhin gtum mo'i me 'bar ba'i //
translated: The fire of caṇḍālī, which has the nature of the a syllable, blazes.

original: pha rol pha rol rnam par 'gro //
analyzed: pha rol pha rol rnam par 'gro //
translated: The other side is the other side, which is said to be the navel.

original: zhes pa'i pha rol ni de bzhin du 'bar bas sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i nang du son par gyur pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i pha rol ni de bzhin du 'bar bas sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i nang du son par gyur pa /
translated: The other side is the fire that arrives inside the emanation wheel by blazing in that way.

original: de las bzhengs te chos kyi 'khor lo thob ste /
analyzed: de las bzhengs te chos kyi 'khor lo thob ste /
translated: Having arisen from that, he attains the wheel of phenomena.

original: der gyur nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs te rang bzhin med par byed do //
analyzed: der gyur nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs te rang bzhin med par byed do //
translated: Having become that, he burns the five transcendent lords and makes them essenceless.

original: de las bzhengs te longs spyod kyi 'khor lo der song ste /
analyzed: de las bzhengs te longs spyod kyi 'khor lo der song ste /
translated: Having arisen from that, he goes to the wheel of enjoyment.

original: yul rnams zos nas spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams bsregs te /
analyzed: yul rnams zos nas spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams bsregs te /
translated: Having eaten the objects, he burns the goddesses such as Lochana and so forth.

original: de'i rjes la rim pa 'dis pha rol ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo rab tu brkyang ste der song nas ham yig de bsregs nas rang bzhin med par byed cing ri bong 'dzin pa 'jug @185a * //🔽bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rim pa 'dis pha rol ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo rab tu brkyang ste der song nas ham yig de bsregs nas rang bzhin med par byed cing ri bong 'dzin pa 'jug @185a * // bar byed do //
translated: After that, by this process, he extends the wheel of great bliss, goes there, burns the syllable ham, makes it essenceless, and enters the rabbit-holding moon.

original: rim pa 'di gtum mo'i rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rim pa 'di gtum mo'i rnal 'byor zhes brjod do //
translated: This process is called the yoga of fierce fire.

original: de skad du yang kye rdo rje las gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad du yang kye rdo rje las gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: lte bar gtum mo sbar ba yis //
analyzed: lte bar gtum mo sbar ba yis //
translated: By igniting the fierce fire at the navel,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs te //
translated: the five transcendent lords are burned.

original: zhes pa de nyid de bzhin du de gtum mo'i rang bzhin bstan pa ste rnam par grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa de nyid de bzhin du de gtum mo'i rang bzhin bstan pa ste rnam par grol ba nyid do //
translated: This is just that, and it teaches the nature of fierce fire, which is liberation.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du rnam par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du rnam par 'gro ba'o //
translated: In the same way, it goes elsewhere.

original: de nyid gtum mo'i bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo nas /
analyzed: de nyid gtum mo'i bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo nas /
translated: From the great-bliss cakra of Caṇḍālī,

original: 'og tu sprul pa'i 'khor lo rnam par 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'og tu sprul pa'i 'khor lo rnam par 'bab pa'o //
translated: it falls below into the emanation cakra.

original: de la sprul pa'i 'khor lo aa yig gi rnam pa'i thig le la rab tu bzhugs nas slar yang thig le de yang mi snang bar nang du thim ste /
analyzed: de la sprul pa'i 'khor lo aa yig gi rnam pa'i thig le la rab tu bzhugs nas slar yang thig le de yang mi snang bar nang du thim ste /
translated: There, having entered the drop in the form of the letter A in the emanation cakra, again that drop disappears and dissolves internally.

original: slar yang rlung gi las kyis bskul nas rnam par langs te yang sngon bzhin du bya ba'o //
analyzed: slar yang rlung gi las kyis bskul nas rnam par langs te yang sngon bzhin du bya ba'o //
translated: Again, impelled by the action of the wind, it rises up and acts as before.

original: de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'gro ste /
translated: It goes elsewhere and elsewhere.

original: dbye ba gnyis su gyur pa steng du 'gro ba dang 'og tu 'bab pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba gnyis su 'gro'o //
analyzed: dbye ba gnyis su gyur pa steng du 'gro ba dang 'og tu 'bab pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba gnyis su 'gro'o //
translated: It goes in two ways, with the characteristics of going above and falling below.

original: de la rnam pa de nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid gtum mo'i rnal 'byor pas shes par byas nas /
analyzed: de la rnam pa de nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid gtum mo'i rnal 'byor pas shes par byas nas /
translated: The yogin of Caṇḍālī, having understood that very nature to be essenceless,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang gi ngo bo nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang gi ngo bo nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: attains the state of Vajrasattva.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba zhes pa ni khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba zhes pa ni khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Going everywhere” is because of pervasiveness.

original: gzhan yang de ci'i phyir na mi g-yo ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i de la gtum mo ste gnyis su med pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin ni yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de ci'i phyir na mi g-yo ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i de la gtum mo ste gnyis su med pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin ni yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Moreover, why is it called “immovable,” and so on? The “inner heat” is the nature of nondual consciousness, which is called “correct consciousness.”

original: 'dzag pa med pa'i dga' ba'i yul ni mi 'dzag ste mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzag pa med pa'i dga' ba'i yul ni mi 'dzag ste mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The object of “undiminishing joy” is “undiminishing,” that is, immovable.

original: de nyid kyi dga' ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dga' ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes pa'i don no //
translated: That very joy is the meaning of “innate joy.”

original: de'i yul de bzhin du gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i yul de bzhin du gsungs te /
translated: Its object is stated in the same way.

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pas chags pa chen po'i mes gtum mo rab tu gsal ba shar nas //
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pas chags pa chen po'i mes gtum mo rab tu gsal ba shar nas //
translated: The fire of great passion, which is the inner heat, arises by the previously explained process.

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor song ste thig le zhu nas mi 'dzag pa nyid bzhi pa'i skad cig gi rang bzhin lhan cig gi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor song ste thig le zhu nas mi 'dzag pa nyid bzhi pa'i skad cig gi rang bzhin lhan cig gi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having gone to the great-bliss chakra, the bindu melts and becomes undiminishing, which is the nature of the fourth instant, the innate joy.

original: de'i phyir de nyid rig pas lhan cig skyes pa'i mtshan nyid la rang bzhin gyi sems gnyis su snang ba'i tshul la rjes su rtogs pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rtogs pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid rig pas lhan cig skyes pa'i mtshan nyid la rang bzhin gyi sems gnyis su snang ba'i tshul la rjes su rtogs pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rtogs pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Therefore, by knowing reality, the yogi realizes the nondual gnosis, which is the realization of the nature of the mind, the way in which the two appear.

original: de bzhin du bzhi pa'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i yul rnal 'byor pas rig par bya ba ni goms par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhi pa'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i yul rnal 'byor pas rig par bya ba ni goms par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the yogi should cultivate the object of the connate bliss in the fourth moment.

original: dam pa'i bde ba 'dod phyir ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba 'dod pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: dam pa'i bde ba 'dod phyir ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba 'dod pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning of “for the sake of desiring the supreme bliss” is “for the sake of desiring the connate bliss.”

original: rnal 'byor pas yang de ni rtogs shing 'jug @185b bar byed pa ni de 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i rtogs pa ni khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas yang de ni rtogs shing 'jug @185b bar byed pa ni de 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i rtogs pa ni khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The yogi should realize and engage that, which is the realization of the nondual nature of the connate joy.

original: de'i 'jug pa mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: His engagement is direct perception.

original: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin gang la de yis rtogs pa 'jug pa rnal 'byor pas 'dir goms par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin gang la de yis rtogs pa 'jug pa rnal 'byor pas 'dir goms par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the yogi should cultivate here the nature of that, in which his realization engages.

original: de bzhin du lhag par rtogs pa'i bdag gi de nyid rnal 'byor pa'i bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag par rtogs pa'i bdag gi de nyid rnal 'byor pa'i bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, he declares the praise of the yogi's self-realization of the reality of the self:

original: de'i ngo bo zhes pa la sogs pa'i de sems dga' ba'i spyod yul ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo zhes pa la sogs pa'i de sems dga' ba'i spyod yul ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The mind that is the object of his delight is the object of innate delight.

original: sems ni yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The mind is the perfect knowledge.

original: gang gi tshe de'i ngo bo rtogs pa nyid 'jug par 'gyur ba ni de'i tshe gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i ngo bo rtogs pa nyid 'jug par 'gyur ba ni de'i tshe gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the realization of his nature itself enters, then the nature of nonduality enters.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sems rnal 'byor pa gang gis mngon sum du byas pa de'i tshe las thams cad byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sems rnal 'byor pa gang gis mngon sum du byas pa de'i tshe las thams cad byed par 'gyur te /
translated: The yogi who has actualized such a mind, at that time, will perform all actions.

original: tshig dang bcas pa ste tshig tsam gyis de bzhin du byed do zhes pa'i don te 'dir the tshom med pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: tshig dang bcas pa ste tshig tsam gyis de bzhin du byed do zhes pa'i don te 'dir the tshom med pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: With words, that is, by mere words, it is done like that, is the meaning. Here, the meaning of without doubt is that.

original: bsam gtan zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i bsam gtan /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i bsam gtan /
translated: Meditation, etc. are the meditations previously mentioned.

original: rnal 'byor yang dag ldan ni bsam gtan dang bsam gtan pa'i mtshan nyid bsam gtan gyis sbyor ba rgyu 'bras bur gyur pa'i snying rje dang shes rab dag gcig pa nyid kyis thabs dang shes rab gcig pa nyid do zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor yang dag ldan ni bsam gtan dang bsam gtan pa'i mtshan nyid bsam gtan gyis sbyor ba rgyu 'bras bur gyur pa'i snying rje dang shes rab dag gcig pa nyid kyis thabs dang shes rab gcig pa nyid do zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The yogi who is endowed with the right means is the yogi who is endowed with the right means, i.e. with compassion and wisdom, which are the cause and effect of the meditation and the meditator. The meaning is that he is one in whom means and insight are one.

original: de dag dang yang dag ldan ni de dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang yang dag ldan ni de dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: Endowed with them is the yogi who possesses them.

original: gzhan yang ci'i phyir na dgod par bya ba ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci'i phyir na dgod par bya ba ni byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, why is it that one should be established?

original: sems la dgod pa ste gang gis mi g-yeng ba'i go 'phang la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems la dgod pa ste gang gis mi g-yeng ba'i go 'phang la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: It is the establishment of the mind, by which one abides in the state of non-distraction.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i sems so //
translated: Therefore, the establishment is the mind that is unmoving.

original: blo ldan ni blo gros gang zhig dge ba'i blo dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: blo ldan ni blo gros gang zhig dge ba'i blo dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The wise one is the one who has the intelligence, i.e. the one who has the virtuous intelligence.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas sa stengs sa 'og bsgrub par bya ba ni mtho ris sa stengs sa 'og thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas sa stengs sa 'og bsgrub par bya ba ni mtho ris sa stengs sa 'og thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The yogi of that kind should accomplish the earth, the sky and the netherworld, i.e. he should accomplish all the heavens, the earth and the netherworld.

original: 'dir mtho ris dngos su gzung ba med kyang sa stengs sa 'og gzung bas de bzhin du tho ris kyang shugs la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mtho ris dngos su gzung ba med kyang sa stengs sa 'og gzung bas de bzhin du tho ris kyang shugs la shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, although the heavens are not actually grasped, since the earth and the underworld are grasped, the heavens should be understood in the same way by implication.

original: 'gro ba kun ngag gi rang bzhin bsgrub pa ni rnam par rtog pa tsam bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun ngag gi rang bzhin bsgrub pa ni rnam par rtog pa tsam bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The establishment of the nature of all beings is to be established as mere conceptualization.

original: da ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin 'jig rten dbang phyug gi go 'phang thob pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin 'jig rten dbang phyug gi go 'phang thob pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
translated: Now, two verses on attaining the state of Lokeśvara, the nature of innate joy.

original: lte ba zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lte ba zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: At the navel, etc.

original: de rnal 'byor pas de @186a * //
analyzed: de rnal 'byor pas de @186a * //
translated: That, by the yogi,

original: bzhin nyid rab tu dgod par byas na 'jig rten mgon po'i skur gyur te /
analyzed: bzhin nyid rab tu dgod par byas na 'jig rten mgon po'i skur gyur te /
translated: when established in suchness, becomes the body of the Lord of the World.

original: ae wam zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'o //
analyzed: ae wam zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i 'o //
translated: E-VAM is explained below.

original: yang na de bzhin zhes pa'i ae yig ni padma /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin zhes pa'i ae yig ni padma /
translated: Or else, the syllable E is the lotus,

original: wam yig ni rdo rje rab tu dgod pa ste /
analyzed: wam yig ni rdo rje rab tu dgod pa ste /
translated: and the syllable VAM is the vajra, the establishment.

original: gang gi tshe thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug par byed pa de'i tshe de'i rnal 'byor pas 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ngo bo nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug par byed pa de'i tshe de'i rnal 'byor pas 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ngo bo nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he causes the union of means and insight, then the yogin attains the nature of Lokeśvara.

original: lte ba'i dbus su padma chen po ni lte bar 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi ni padma chen po'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su padma chen po ni lte bar 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi ni padma chen po'o //
translated: In the middle of the navel is the great lotus, with sixty-four petals in the navel, the great lotus.

original: de'i de bzhin du padma'i nam mkha'i nang ni ze 'bru'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin du padma'i nam mkha'i nang ni ze 'bru'i mtha'o //
translated: In its center, in the space of the lotus, is the edge of the pistils.

original: de la gang gi tshe gtum mo 'bar bas thig le zhu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe gtum mo 'bar bas thig le zhu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There, when the candālī fire blazes, the bindu melts.

original: ji ltar rnam gsum pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam gsum pa zhe na /
translated: How is it threefold?

original: 'gro ba'i rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three types of movement of the world.

original: de la gang gi tshe g-yo bar gyur pa na bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'gro'o //🔽gang gi tshe 'dzag par 'gyur ba ni snying ga'i 'khor lo thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe g-yo bar gyur pa na bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'gro'o // gang gi tshe 'dzag par 'gyur ba ni snying ga'i 'khor lo thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it moves, the wheel of great bliss moves.🔽When it drips, it reaches the heart wheel.

original: gang gi tshe mi 'dzag par gyur pa na lte ba'i 'khor lo thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi 'dzag par gyur pa na lte ba'i 'khor lo thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it does not drip, it reaches the navel wheel.

original: de bzhin rnam gsum ni rnam pa gsum du 'gro bas nam mkha'i nang du song ba'i thig le'o //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam gsum ni rnam pa gsum du 'gro bas nam mkha'i nang du song ba'i thig le'o //
translated: Likewise, the three-fold is the drop that has gone into space, since it goes to the three places.

original: de bzhin rnam pa 'dis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi thig le ni padma'i phyag rgya yang dag ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam pa 'dis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi thig le ni padma'i phyag rgya yang dag ldan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, by this aspect, the drop that is the nature of innate joy is the seal of the lotus consort.

original: de la padma'i phyag rgya ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang thabs su gyur pa wam dang / ae yig gi rnam pa shes rab kyi padma'o //
analyzed: de la padma'i phyag rgya ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang thabs su gyur pa wam dang / ae yig gi rnam pa shes rab kyi padma'o //
translated: There, the seal of the lotus is the consort who is the means for the supramundane wisdom, the lotus of wisdom in the form of the letters vaṃ and e.

original: h'um yig gi lhag mar gnas pa ni thabs te rdo rje'i rtse mor son pas 'od zer rnam par gsal ba ni dga' ba chen po'i cha gang yin rgyas gdab ste rang gis mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: h'um yig gi lhag mar gnas pa ni thabs te rdo rje'i rtse mor son pas 'od zer rnam par gsal ba ni dga' ba chen po'i cha gang yin rgyas gdab ste rang gis mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: The remainder of the letter hūṃ is the means, which is the tip of the vajra, and the part that is the light of great joy is the seal, which is made manifest by oneself.

original: de'i padma ni phyag rgya zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i padma ni phyag rgya zhes brjod do //
translated: That lotus is called the seal.

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin du /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin du /
translated: The nature of wisdom is likewise.

original: yang rdo rje nyi ma reg 'od kyis /
analyzed: yang rdo rje nyi ma reg 'od kyis /
translated: Again, the vajra sun, the light of touch,

original: rab pad rgya yis gdab pa yis //
analyzed: rab pad rgya yis gdab pa yis //
translated: seals the lotus with expansion,

original: padmar bde chen che shas ni //
analyzed: padmar bde chen che shas ni //
translated: the part of great bliss in the lotus,

original: padma'i phyag rgyar shes par bya //
analyzed: padma'i phyag rgyar shes par bya //
translated: One should know the lotus gesture.

original: gzhan yang / bsgrub bya sgrub thabs yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bsgrub bya sgrub thabs yang dag sbyor //
translated: Moreover, the true union of the object of attainment and the means of attainment

original: gang de bsnyen pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang de bsnyen pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Is called “approach.”

original: rdo rje padma mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: rdo rje padma mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of the vajra and lotus

original: nye bar sgrub pa zhes byar brjod //
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pa zhes byar brjod //
translated: Is called “near attainment.”

original: bskyod par gsungs pa sgrub pa ste //
analyzed: bskyod par gsungs pa sgrub pa ste //
translated: The shaking taught is “attainment,”

original: h'um phat yi ge yang dag ldan //
analyzed: h'um phat yi ge yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the syllables hūṃ and phaṭ.

original: rang bzhin shin tu zhi bde ba //
analyzed: rang bzhin shin tu zhi bde ba //
translated: The nature is complete peace and bliss,

original: sgrub pa chen po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po zhes brjod do //
translated: Called “great attainment.”

original: 'od gsal gyi shes pa'i thabs su gyur pa sgrib pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid wam yig rdo rje nor bu bde ba chen po'i cha gang gis rgyas gdab pa ni mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi shes pa'i thabs su gyur pa sgrib pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid wam yig rdo rje nor bu bde ba chen po'i cha gang gis rgyas gdab pa ni mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: The means of clear light consciousness, the identity free from obscurations, the syllable vaṃ, the vajra jewel, the part of great bliss, the one who seals, is actualized.

original: de nam mkha'i phyag @186b rgya zhes brjod pa de de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nam mkha'i phyag @186b rgya zhes brjod pa de de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That is called the “sky mudra,” and that is its identity.

original: gzhan yang rdo rje rtse mor rdzogs //
analyzed: gzhan yang rdo rje rtse mor rdzogs //
translated: Moreover, perfected at the vajra tip,

original: gang gis bde chen ri bong 'dzin //

analyzed: nam mkha'i phyag rgya'i rang bzhin yang thabs te /

analyzed: h'um yig gi rang bzhin snying ga'i 'khor lo des kyang thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa ste /

analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pas rnal 'byor pas ae yig dang wam yig rab tu dgod par bya'o //

analyzed: des 'jig rten mgon po'i sku ru 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'dir yang sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pa las 'das te bzlas pa la sogs pa byed pa bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, here, one who recites the mantra and so on in violation of the procedure taught earlier is like that.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'i cho ga dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor pa las gang dang gang byed pa ste /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'i cho ga dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor pa las gang dang gang byed pa ste /

analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i las ni yid kyir 'dod pa ste /

original: de ni myur du 'grub par byed par the tshom med do //
analyzed: de ni myur du 'grub par byed par the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt that it will quickly be accomplished.

original: 'di ni padma 'bar ba las byung ba'i rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi lnga bcu pa'i bdag gi de kho na nyid kyi le'u'i rnam par 'grel pa ste gnyis pa'o /

translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter, on the reality of the self, of the Perfection of Wisdom in 500 Lines, which arose from the blazing lotus.

original: // / da ni lha'i de kho na nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni lha'i de kho na nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now the reality of the deity should be explained.

original: dang por bcom ldan 'das @187a * //

translated: First, the method of accomplishing the Bhagavān

analyzed: kyi sgrub thabs bshad pa ni tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo bo bshad par bya ste /
translated: is explained by way of four verses, explaining the essence of the Bhagavān.

original: rang bzhin bsam gtan bcas pa yis //
analyzed: rang bzhin bsam gtan bcas pa yis //
translated: With the nature and meditative stabilization,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: de la dang po re zhig gang gi tshe sgrub pa po'i rnal 'byor pas bcom ldan 'das kyi sgrub thabs rtsom par byed pa de'i tshe rang gi snying gar pam yig las skyes pa'i padma las aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par

translated: First, when the practitioner yogi composes the sādhana of the Bhagavān, at that time, he should meditate on a lotus arisen from the syllable paṃ in his heart, and from that, an a syllable, which transforms into a moon maṇḍala.

original: bya'o // de'i steng du bcom ldan 'das kyi sa bon gyi yi ge hr'i:bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de'i steng du bcom ldan 'das kyi sa bon gyi yi ge hr'i:bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On that, he should meditate on the seed syllable of the Bhagavān, hṛīḥ.

original: de las 'od zer 'phros te 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis rang gi lus rab tu gsal bar byas nas rjes su dran pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'od zer 'phros te 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis rang gi lus rab tu gsal bar byas nas rjes su dran pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From that, light shines forth, and the assembly of light rays illuminates his body, and he should meditate on the four recollections.

translated: For the sake of liberating the realms of sentient beings from that suffering and increasing the collection of merit, meditate that the whole sky is filled with your meditation deity, the buddhas, and the bodhisattvas.

original: / slar yang sa bon gyi yi ge'i 'od zer rnams kyis me tog ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams spros nas lha'i tshogs la mchod par byas la /🔽slar yang / dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi //

translated: Again, emanate offering goddesses such as the flower goddess with light rays from the seed syllable, and make offerings to the assembly of deities.

original: la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: yang de'i 'od zer lcags kyu'i rnam pa des lha'i tshogs bkug nas sa bon gyi yi ge la zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Again, meditate that the hook-like light rays from that seed syllable summon the assembly of deities and they enter the seed syllable.

translated: And one should meditate that all the realms of sentient beings enter into the seed syllable of the Buddha.

analyzed: de nas de bzhin du sh'u n+ya t'as brtan par byed pa'i sngags 'di brjod par bya ste /

translated: The syllable om is Vairocana,

analyzed: @187b sh'u n+ya t'a zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no // dzny'a na zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: ŚŪNYATĀ is Ratnasaṃbhava.🔽JÑĀNA is Akṣobhya.

analyzed: badzra zhes pa ni 'od dpag med do //

analyzed: de nyid bsdus pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du lta ba dang spro bar lta ba'o //
translated: The nature of the compendium is the view of emptiness and the view of emanation.

analyzed: bsdu pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste de nyid shes rab tu brjod do //
translated: The compendium is ultimate truth, which is called wisdom.

analyzed: sbro ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste thabs so //
translated: Emanation is conventional truth, which is method.

original: de'i don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig ni /
analyzed: de'i don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig ni /
translated: The ultimate truth alone

original: gzhan don rdzogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan don rdzogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /

analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i mthar sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ultimate truth is attained as buddhahood at the end.

analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid spro bar blta bar bya'o //

original: de'i phyir thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de nyid kyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that alone, everything is accomplished.

analyzed: de la dang por ra yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro /
translated: First, the letter ra is transformed into a sun maṇḍala.

analyzed: de'i steng du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa /
translated: Above that, the letter hūṃ is transformed into a five-pronged vajra.

analyzed: de las 'od zer rdo rje'i gzugs kyis 'phros te /
translated: From that, light rays radiate in the form of vajras.

analyzed: de las 'od zer 'bar bas rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang rdo rje'i gur rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From that, one should visualize the blazing light rays as the vajra ground and vajra tent.🔽In the center of that, the letter hūṃ is transformed into all phenomena without inherent existence.

analyzed: de'i dbus su h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las chos thams cad rang bzhin med par bsgoms la phyi nas chos 'phyung dkar po bsgom par bya ste /

analyzed: dkar po nyid ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid do //
translated: White is the utterly pure realm of phenomena.

analyzed: de'i steng du pam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //

analyzed: de'i steng du aom yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: On top of that, the letter OṂ becomes a moon disk.

analyzed: de'i steng du hr'i:h'um dza:zhes pa'i yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las lcags kyu /
translated: On top of that, the three letters HRĪḤ HŪṂ JAH become a hook.

analyzed: rang bzhin bsam gtan bcas pa yis ni gnas kyi don thams cad kyi gang gi rang bzhin med pa zhes bshad do //
translated: By means of the nature and meditation, all the meanings of the abode are explained as “without nature.”

translated: Its meditation is dhyā-cintā, and it should be seen as meditation with that, and it has the meaning of “endowed.”

original: dz'a ti mtshal gyi 'od zer mtshungs //
analyzed: dz'a ti mtshal gyi 'od zer mtshungs //
translated: Jāti is like the light of vermilion.

original: zhes pa'i dz'a ti dang mtshal zhes pa ni tshon gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: zhes pa'i dz'a ti dang mtshal zhes pa ni tshon gyi bye brag go //
translated: Jāti and vermilion are a type of dye.

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer dmar po zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer dmar po zhes pa'i don no //
translated: It has the meaning of “red light rays like that.”
The lotus is red.

analyzed: 'bru le brgan rtsi dang 'dra ba ni 'od 'bar zhing sindhu ra ltar dmar ba ste gtso bo li khri ltar dmar ba'o //
translated: Like vermillion is the blazing light, red like sindūra, the principal one being red like lac.

original: 'dir yang gtso bo ni yang 'od dpag tu med pa ste de dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang gtso bo ni yang 'od dpag tu med pa ste de dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Here also, the principal one is Amitābha, along with him.

original: gzhan yang sngags kyi gzugs kyi ni yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sngags dang  dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngags kyi gzugs kyi ni yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sngags dang  dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in the form of mantra, he is inseparable from the mantra consisting of the three syllables.

original: lha'i lha ni lha rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa'i phyir lha'i lha'o //
analyzed: lha'i lha ni lha rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa'i phyir lha'i lha'o //
translated: The god of gods is the god of gods because he is the lord of the gods.

original: skad cig gis mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir zhal gcig pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gis mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir zhal gcig pa'o //
translated: He has one face because he is fully enlightened in an instant.

original: phyag ni bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: phyag ni bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: His four arms are the victory over the four māras.

original: mkha' pad zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs //
analyzed: mkha' pad zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs //
translated: He sits on a space, lotus, and moon seat.

original: zhes pa ni sngon du bshad pa'i chos 'byung padma zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon du bshad pa'i chos 'byung padma zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He sits on a lotus and moon seat, the source of phenomena explained previously.

original: zhags pa lcags kyu bsnams pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir zhags pa dang gdug pa can rnams 'gugs pa'i phyir lcags kyu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: zhags pa lcags kyu bsnams pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir zhags pa dang gdug pa can rnams 'gugs pa'i phyir lcags kyu bsnams pa'o //
translated: He holds a noose and a goad because he holds beings to be trained and because he goads the wicked.

original: khyab bdag ni dbang phyug la sogs pa gtso bo yon tan sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ni dbang phyug la sogs pa gtso bo yon tan sbyor ba'o //
translated: The all-pervading lord is the chief quality of the almighty, etc.

original: mchog sbyin phyag rgya ni nor bu ste /
analyzed: mchog sbyin phyag rgya ni nor bu ste /
translated: The boon-granting mudra is the jewel.

original: phyag rab tu brkyang na gzhan gyi don gyi phyir nor bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gis chu skyes zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: phyag rab tu brkyang na gzhan gyi don gyi phyir nor bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gis chu skyes zhes pa'i don no //
translated: When the hand is fully extended, it is the lotus with the jewel hand for the sake of others.

original: yang dag rol pa nyid ni sgeg pa'i nyams gtso bo'i phyir te sgeg pa dang bcas pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: yang dag rol pa nyid ni sgeg pa'i nyams gtso bo'i phyir te sgeg pa dang bcas pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The true sport is the mood of grace, because it is the chief. It means “with grace.”

original: mu tig nor bus rnam par brgyan ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa'i phyir nor bus rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: mu tig nor bus rnam par brgyan ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa'i phyir nor bus rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: Adorned with pearls and jewels means adorned with jewels because of natural stainlessness.

original: thams cad la rab tu 'gro ba ster ba'i phyir mu tig gis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la rab tu 'gro ba ster ba'i phyir mu tig gis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: Adorned with pearls because it bestows the highest on all.

original: padma'i phyag ni padma'i phyag rgya dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma'i phyag ni padma'i phyag rgya dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: His lotus hands are in union with the lotus gesture.

original: yang na padma bzhin du sems can gyi don la 'khor ba'i nang du gnas kyang 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na padma bzhin du sems can gyi don la 'khor ba'i nang du gnas kyang 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, like the lotus, he remains in the midst of the world in order to benefit beings, without being soiled by the faults of the world.

original: padma'i phyag rgya ni phyag g-yon padmas brgyan pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: padma'i phyag rgya ni phyag g-yon padmas brgyan pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The lotus gesture is the adornment of the left hand with a lotus.

original: sku gsung thugs rnam par dag pa'i phyir spyan gsum mo //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs rnam par dag pa'i phyir spyan gsum mo //
translated: He has three eyes because his body, speech, and mind are pure.

original: gdul bya sna tshogs gdul bar dgongs pas sna tshogs pa'i tshul 'dzin pa ni sna tshogs sku'o //
analyzed: gdul bya sna tshogs gdul bar dgongs pas sna tshogs pa'i tshul 'dzin pa ni sna tshogs sku'o //
translated: He has a variegated body because he assumes a variegated form in order to convert the various beings to be converted.

original: 'od zer stong ldan bzhin du ma rig pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pas gzi brjid chen po ste 'od gsal chen po zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'od zer stong ldan bzhin du ma rig pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pas gzi brjid chen po ste 'od gsal chen po zhes pa'i don no //
translated: He is a great splendor because he dispels the darkness of ignorance with a thousand rays.

original: gdug pa can thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: gdug pa can thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the lord of heroes because he is victorious over all evildoers.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi bdag po'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon no //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi bdag po'i phyir 'gro ba'i mgon no //
translated: He is the protector of beings because he is the lord of all beings.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams thugs dgyes pa ni lhan @188b cig skyes pa'i dga' pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yid tshim par byed pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams thugs dgyes pa ni lhan @188b cig skyes pa'i dga' pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yid tshim par byed pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The yoginīs are delighted by the essence of coemergent joy, which is the meaning of “satisfying the minds of the yoginīs.”

original: sngags rnams kun la zhes pa ni sngags thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: sngags rnams kun la zhes pa ni sngags thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: “ In all mantras” means the abode of all mantras, which is the meaning of “the abode of all mantras.”

original: rnam pa de lta bus bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should meditate on the Bhagavān, the lord of the lineage.

original: dngos grub thams cad rab ster ba ni phyag rgya rab tu ster ba zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad rab ster ba ni phyag rgya rab tu ster ba zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: “ Bestowing all powers” means bestowing the mudra, which is the meaning of “bestowing the mudra.”

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i dam tshig sems dpa'i ngo bor bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i dam tshig sems dpa'i ngo bor bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the pledge-being in this way,

original: slar yang nam mkha'i mthil du rnam pa de lta bu nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang nam mkha'i mthil du rnam pa de lta bu nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: again, in the center of the sky, one should meditate on the Bhagavān in the form of the gnosis-being in just this way.

original: de lta bu'i ye she sems dpa' dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pa'i yi ge rnam pa bzhis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / mnyes pa rnams dam tshig sems sems dpa'i nang du bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye she sems dpa' dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pa'i yi ge rnam pa bzhis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / mnyes pa rnams dam tshig sems sems dpa'i nang du bya'o //
translated: The four syllables of the awareness being, JAH HUM BAM HOH, are for summoning, inducting, binding, and delighting, which are to be done with the pledge being.

original: slar yang ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar padma dang zla ba la hr'i:yig gi sa bon ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar padma dang zla ba la hr'i:yig gi sa bon ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Again, in the heart of the awareness being, on a lotus and moon, one should meditate on the syllable HRĪḤ, which is the essence of the concentration being.

original: de'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis nam mkha'i mthil du de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i tshogs bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis nam mkha'i mthil du de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i tshogs bsam par bya'o //
translated: Light rays from that syllable invite the hosts of tathāgatas and goddesses to the expanse of the sky.

original: de rnams rnal 'byor pas dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams rnal 'byor pas dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: The practitioner should request the empowerment:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am /
translated: Oṃ, all tathāgatas, please confer the empowerment here.

original: phyi nas de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i tshogs su bcas pas dbang bskur bar bsams te /
analyzed: phyi nas de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i tshogs su bcas pas dbang bskur bar bsams te /
translated: Then one should imagine that the empowerment is conferred by the hosts of tathāgatas and goddesses.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka sa ma ya shri ye h'um zhes pa'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka sa ma ya shri ye h'um zhes pa'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra Om sarva tathāgata abhiṣekasamaya śrīye hūm.

original: de lta bu'i bsam gtan byas te sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam gtan byas te sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra while performing such meditation.

original: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i sgrub thabs kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i sgrub thabs kyi rim pa'o //
translated: This is the sequence of the concise sādhana.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pas sngon du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pas sngon du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the Blessed One in the manner described above.

original: gang dang gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgrub pa po'i rnal 'byor pa gang gis gang bsgom pa'i bsam pas rnal 'byor goms pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgrub pa po'i rnal 'byor pa gang gis gang bsgom pa'i bsam pas rnal 'byor goms pa ste /
translated: With whatever, etc. refers to the practitioner's yoga. With whatever means of meditation, the yoga is cultivated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yoga of the Blessed One should be fully meditated upon.

original: de dang de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de bcom ldan 'das de'i rang bzhin te de'i ngo rab ster //
analyzed: de dang de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de bcom ldan 'das de'i rang bzhin te de'i ngo rab ster //
translated: By the power of that intention, one becomes of the nature of that Blessed One, one's essence becomes that.

original: de bzhin dag ni rab ni zhi ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bcom ldan 'das bsgom pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin dag ni rab ni zhi ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bcom ldan 'das bsgom pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One should be meditated upon in accordance with the ritual action of pacifying, etc.

original: lha ni dkar pos zhi rab ster //
analyzed: lha ni dkar pos zhi rab ster //
translated: The god white in color bestows peace well.

original: de bzhin dag ni rab @189a * //🔽sad byed // ces pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin dag ni rab @189a * // sad byed // ces pa ste /
translated: In the same way, one should purify well.

original: gang gi tshon la 'byor pas zhi ba'i las 'ga' zhig byed na /
analyzed: gang gi tshon la 'byor pas zhi ba'i las 'ga' zhig byed na /
translated: When one performs some rite of pacification by means of the color white,

original: de'i tshe des bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe des bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po bsgom par bya ste /
translated: at that time one should contemplate the Blessed One as white in color.

original: bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar pos zhi ba rab tu ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar pos zhi ba rab tu ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the Blessed One, white in color, bestows peace well.

original: 'dir bsgom pa'i rim pas ni zhi ba'i las byed pa'i skabs su rnal 'byor pa zhal byang du phyogs te bsgom par bya'o //🔽de la dang por wa yig dkar po yongs su gyur pa las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa'i rim pas ni zhi ba'i las byed pa'i skabs su rnal 'byor pa zhal byang du phyogs te bsgom par bya'o // de la dang por wa yig dkar po yongs su gyur pa las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Here, in the context of performing the rite of pacification by means of the stage of meditation, the yogin should contemplate facing north.🔽There, first, one should contemplate a round water maṇḍala arisen from the transformation of the white syllable vaṃ.

original: de'i steng du bdag nyid rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug sku mdog dkar po rnam par snang mdzad lta bu rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbu brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du bdag nyid rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug sku mdog dkar po rnam par snang mdzad lta bu rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbu brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Above that, one should contemplate oneself as the lord of the family, white in color like Vairocana, with Vairocana as the crest jewel.

original: de la yang ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo'i rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rang bzhin gzhan bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo'i rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rang bzhin gzhan bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In that, one should meditate on the nature of the other, the Lord of the World, who is the essence of the gnosis being.

original: ye shes sems dpa' de'i thugs kar padma dang zla ba la bsgrub bya'i lus bkug ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' de'i thugs kar padma dang zla ba la bsgrub bya'i lus bkug ste /
translated: At the heart of that gnosis being, on a lotus and moon, one should imagine the body of the person for whose sake one is performing the rite,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams thim par bsam mo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams thim par bsam mo //
translated: and imagine that the afflictions dissolve into that.

original: de'i rjes la ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i zla ba la yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sngags kyi phreng ba bzhengs te bdud rtsi'i rgyun 'bab par byed pas bsgrub bya'i lus la dmigs shing snang bar byas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i zla ba la yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi sngags kyi phreng ba bzhengs te bdud rtsi'i rgyun 'bab par byed pas bsgrub bya'i lus la dmigs shing snang bar byas te /
translated: After that, one should imagine that the mantra garland, which is the nature of the three syllables, arises on the moon at the heart of the gnosis being and that it causes a stream of nectar to descend.

original: rang gi lus las 'od zer rnam par 'phros te rtse mo'i cha las dpag tu med pa'i lha mo'i tshogs su gyur nas /
analyzed: rang gi lus las 'od zer rnam par 'phros te rtse mo'i cha las dpag tu med pa'i lha mo'i tshogs su gyur nas /
translated: One should visualize the person for whose sake one is performing the rite, and imagine that light radiates from one’s body and that an immeasurable host of goddesses arises from the tips of the light rays.

original: bdud rtsis yongs su gang ba'i bum pa phyag na bsnams pas /
analyzed: bdud rtsis yongs su gang ba'i bum pa phyag na bsnams pas /
translated: They hold vases filled with nectar in their hands

original: bsgrub bya la mngon par dbang bskur te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya la mngon par dbang bskur te /
translated: and confer the actual empowerment on the person for whose sake one is performing the rite.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du gyur pa'i lha mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bdag po thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa las yang dag par byung pa'i byang chub kyi sems gyi rgyun gyis kyang dbang bskur zhing nyes pa rnams ye bar zhi bar bya'o zhes pa
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du gyur pa'i lha mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bdag po thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa las yang dag par byung pa'i byang chub kyi sems gyi rgyun gyis kyang dbang bskur zhing nyes pa rnams ye bar zhi bar bya'o zhes pa
translated: Likewise, the lord who has entered into union with the goddess who is the continuum of the stream of bodhicitta that arises from the union of method and wisdom should also confer empowerment and completely pacify faults.

original: ni zhi ba'i las kyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: ni zhi ba'i las kyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual of the pacifying activity.

original: de'i rjes su ngag rab tu sad par byed pa ni shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su ngag rab tu sad par byed pa ni shes par bya ste /
translated: After that, one should understand the awakening of speech.

original: ngag rab tu sad pa ni zhal dang phyag dang sku mdog dang dbyibs la sogs pa thams cad snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ngag rab tu sad pa ni zhal dang phyag dang sku mdog dang dbyibs la sogs pa thams cad snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The awakening of speech is all the same as before, such as the face, hands, color, shape, and so on.

original: 'on kyang rang gi sems thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi mi shes pas rab tu bcings pa'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas zin pa'i sems nyid kyi nyon mongs pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba rab tu ster ba rnam par snang mdzad
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi sems thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi mi shes pas rab tu bcings pa'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas zin pa'i sems nyid kyi nyon mongs pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba rab tu ster ba rnam par snang mdzad
translated: However, the mind that is bound by the ignorance of beginningless traces of ignorance, which is the mind that is seized by the clinging to I and mine, is the mind that grants the complete pacification of all afflictions.🔽Vairocana

original: dkar po me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi @189b ngo bor bsgam par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi @189b ngo bor bsgam par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the white one as having the nature of the mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: de'i ngag rab tu sad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ngag rab tu sad par 'gyur ro //
translated: His speech will be purified.

original: de nyid zhi ba'i las dang / ngag rab tu sang ba las bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid zhi ba'i las dang / ngag rab tu sang ba las bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: For the pacifying rite and for purifying speech, one should meditate on the Blessed One as white in color.

original: de ni dbang dang dgug pa'i cho ga ste //
analyzed: de ni dbang dang dgug pa'i cho ga ste //
translated: This is the rite of subjugation and attraction.

original: dbang dang dgug pa'i de nyid la sku mdog dmar po rnam par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa'i de nyid la sku mdog dmar po rnam par bsam par bya ste /
translated: For the reality of subjugation and attraction, one should visualize the red-colored one.

original: de ni dbang dang dgug pa'i las la bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dmar po bsgom zhing zhal dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa sngon ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ni dbang dang dgug pa'i las la bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dmar po bsgom zhing zhal dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa sngon ma bzhin du'o //
translated: For the rite of subjugation and attraction, one should meditate on the Blessed One as red in color, with the same face, hand implements, and so forth as before.

original: 'dir bsgom pa'i rim pa ni rnal 'byor pas zhal nub tu mngon par phyogs te /
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa'i rim pa ni rnal 'byor pas zhal nub tu mngon par phyogs te /
translated: Here is the sequence of meditation: The yogī should face west.

original: ya yig yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du 'od dpag tu med pas dbu brgyan pa sgeg pa'i nyams gtso bor mdzad pa'i rang nyid rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: ya yig yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du 'od dpag tu med pas dbu brgyan pa sgeg pa'i nyams gtso bor mdzad pa'i rang nyid rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: From the transformation of the syllable ya, on a wind mandala, one should meditate on oneself as the Lord of the Family, Akashagarbha, with the principal aspect of the mood of grace, crowned by Amitabha.

original: phyi nas rang gi snying ga'i hr'am:yig yongs su gyur pa las h'um las byung ba'i padma'i sdong bu las 'od zer gyi skud pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma dmar po bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rang gi snying ga'i hr'am:yig yongs su gyur pa las h'um las byung ba'i padma'i sdong bu las 'od zer gyi skud pa dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma dmar po bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, from the transformation of the syllable hrīḥ in one's heart, one should imagine a red lotus with eight petals, arising from a lotus stalk with a thread of light from the syllable hrīḥ,

original: 'dab ma so so la sa bon gyi yi ge dmar po gsum ste hr'i; h'um dzdza:rnams bsam zhing ge sar bkod pa'i ze 'bru la hr'i:yig gnyis kyis rnam par brten pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi yi ge gsum gyi sngags rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: 'dab ma so so la sa bon gyi yi ge dmar po gsum ste hr'i; h'um dzdza:rnams bsam zhing ge sar bkod pa'i ze 'bru la hr'i:yig gnyis kyis rnam par brten pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi yi ge gsum gyi sngags rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: with three red seed syllables on each petal, hrīḥ, hūṃ, and jjaḥ, and on the pericarp, the three syllables of the Blessed One, supported by two hrīḥ syllables.

original: de'i sngags las 'od zer dmar pos myos byed myos par byed pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i sngags las 'od zer dmar pos myos byed myos par byed pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor bskyed de /
translated: From the mantra, red light rays intoxicate the intoxicant, generating the wind mandala.

original: phyogs kyi 'khor lo thams cad khyab nas bsgrub bya'i lus 'dod pas pha rol gyi dbang du 'gyur zhing myos par byas pa mdun du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi 'khor lo thams cad khyab nas bsgrub bya'i lus 'dod pas pha rol gyi dbang du 'gyur zhing myos par byas pa mdun du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Having pervaded all the wheels of the directions, the body of the victim is made to be under the control of the lover, and he is made to be intoxicated.

original: zhags pas mgul ba bcings shing snying ga'i padma lcags kyus phug ste //
analyzed: zhags pas mgul ba bcings shing snying ga'i padma lcags kyus phug ste //
translated: The neck is bound with a noose, and the heart lotus is pierced with a hook.

original: bha ga'i padmar de bzhin du 'dod pa'i mtshon gyis bsnun pas 'khrugs shing rab tu myos pa rnam par bsam mo //
analyzed: bha ga'i padmar de bzhin du 'dod pa'i mtshon gyis bsnun pas 'khrugs shing rab tu myos pa rnam par bsam mo //
translated: Then, as one is struck with the weapon of passion in the bhaga lotus, one should imagine that the victim is disturbed and completely intoxicated.

analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi zhal ni chos 'byung gi bdag nyid du gnas so //
