translated: The meaning of the verse is easy to understand.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sprub pa pos dang por re zhig sgrib pa dang bral mtshungs pa ni sgrib pa las des par grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sprub pa pos dang por re zhig sgrib pa dang bral mtshungs pa ni sgrib pa las des par grol ba'o //
translated: And so on. The creator first of all, at the outset, is free from obscuration, is liberated from obscuration.

original: rang lus rnam par blta bar bya ba ni de rang lus la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang lus rnam par blta bar bya ba ni de rang lus la blta bar bya ste /
translated: The body should be seen, should be seen in one’s own body.🔽There,

original: de la / sgrib pa dang bral mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la / sgrib pa dang bral mtshungs pa'o //
translated: he is free from obscuration.

original: lus kyi dbus su rab tu bzhengs pa'i sngags ni hr'i:yig dmar po zhes te de nyid dang po'i yi ge'i rang bzhin yi ge'i dbang por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbus su rab tu bzhengs pa'i sngags ni hr'i:yig dmar po zhes te de nyid dang po'i yi ge'i rang bzhin yi ge'i dbang por shes par bya'o //
translated: The mantra that stands in the middle of the body is the red letter HRĪḤ, which should be known as the lord of the letters, the nature of the first letter.

original: de bzhin du 'bar zhing 'babs pa'i dbyibs ni mar me 'bar ba dang / me lta bus zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bar zhing 'babs pa'i dbyibs ni mar me 'bar ba dang / me lta bus zhes pa'i don no //
translated: And likewise, the shape of the blazing and falling is like a blazing lamp and fire.

original: gzhan yang kha dog dmar po ni padma'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang kha dog dmar po ni padma'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the red color is the form of the lotus.

original: rang gi zhal gyi nang nas 'thon te kha'i sgor rol ni bsgrub bya'i sgo ste bsgrub bya'i kha'i sgo ru zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: rang gi zhal gyi nang nas 'thon te kha'i sgor rol ni bsgrub bya'i sgo ste bsgrub bya'i kha'i sgo ru zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Having emerged from one’s own mouth, it plays at the door of the mouth. The door of the mouth of the one to be liberated is the meaning of “at the door of the one to be liberated.”

original: de la mngon 'dod rol pa ste bsgrub bya'i kha'i sgor yongs su 'khor ba zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de la mngon 'dod rol pa ste bsgrub bya'i kha'i sgor yongs su 'khor ba zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that it is completely surrounded by the mouth of the object of attainment.

original: phyi nas de nyid yi ge rnams bsgrub bya'i khar thim nas ji srid bsgrub bya'i snying ga'i ru skyes la thim par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas de nyid yi ge rnams bsgrub bya'i khar thim nas ji srid bsgrub bya'i snying ga'i ru skyes la thim par bsam par bya'o //
translated: After that, the syllables dissolve into the mouth of the object of attainment and one should imagine that they dissolve into the ra at the heart of the object of attainment.

original: phyi nas de'i mthar snying gar cung zad gnas pa thams cad de'i mthar zhes pa ni dang po'i yi ge'i mthar ni h'um yig go //
analyzed: phyi nas de'i mthar snying gar cung zad gnas pa thams cad de'i mthar zhes pa ni dang po'i yi ge'i mthar ni h'um yig go //
translated: After that, all that remains there a little at the heart is at the end of that. The syllable at the end of the first syllable is the syllable hūṃ.

original: de nyid kyi gzugs kyis de yang rab tu zhugs @193b te bsgrub bya'i snying gar gang cung zad gnas pa thams cad phrogs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gzugs kyis de yang rab tu zhugs @193b te bsgrub bya'i snying gar gang cung zad gnas pa thams cad phrogs te /
translated: By the form of that, that also enters and takes away all that remains there a little at the heart of the object of attainment.

original: de yang mer mer po'i rang bzhin dkar dmar gyi rang bzhin sgrol ma'i gzugs ga pur gyi rnam pa de nyid de /
analyzed: de yang mer mer po'i rang bzhin dkar dmar gyi rang bzhin sgrol ma'i gzugs ga pur gyi rnam pa de nyid de /
translated: That also is the nature of the kalala, the nature of the white and red, the form of Tārā, the form of camphor.

original: yid 'phrog pa thams cad des yi ge blang bar bya ba len pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: yid 'phrog pa thams cad des yi ge blang bar bya ba len pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that all that is captivating is taken away by that syllable.

original: phyi nas gang bsgrub bya'i lus stong par bya ste /
analyzed: phyi nas gang bsgrub bya'i lus stong par bya ste /
translated: After that, one should empty the body of the object of attainment.

original: de'i tsha dzdza:zhes pa'i gsum pa'i yi ges rlung gis lo ma g-yo ba ltar byas te /
analyzed: de'i tsha dzdza:zhes pa'i gsum pa'i yi ges rlung gis lo ma g-yo ba ltar byas te /
translated: The third syllable of tathājjñā is jñā, which is like a leaf moved by the wind.

original: rang gi khyim ni rang gi lus la thim nas lus bsgrub bya'i lus dang ngo bo gcig tu gyur par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi khyim ni rang gi lus la thim nas lus bsgrub bya'i lus dang ngo bo gcig tu gyur par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate that one's own house dissolves into one's own body, and that one's body becomes of the same nature as the body of the one to be accomplished.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa 'dis lha'i lha ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug zhag bdun du bsgrub par byas pas de'i nor dang bcas pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis bran byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa 'dis lha'i lha ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug zhag bdun du bsgrub par byas pas de'i nor dang bcas pa'i skye bo thams cad kyis bran byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this kind of method, one should accomplish the god of gods, the Blessed One, the Lord of the Family, for seven days. Then all beings, together with their wealth, will become one's servants.

original: 'tsho ba dang ni nor gyis kyang //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang ni nor gyis kyang //
translated: And with life and wealth,

original: sa steng 'jig rten slar ci smos //
analyzed: sa steng 'jig rten slar ci smos //
translated: what need to speak of the world on the earth?

original: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
translated: Accomplishment is certain in this.

original: de bzhin the tshom med pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de bzhin the tshom med pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning of without doubt.

original: da ni 'di'i sngags kyi dbang du bya ba'i yul gyi rnam par dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni 'di'i sngags kyi dbang du bya ba'i yul gyi rnam par dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis gsungs so //
translated: Now, in two verses, he declares the classification of the objects of power of this mantra.

original: rang dbang med rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'i 'dir sngags kyi dbang po ni rgyal po ste /
analyzed: rang dbang med rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'i 'dir sngags kyi dbang po ni rgyal po ste /
translated: Here the king is the lord of the mantra.

original: sgrub pa pos 'dir rang dbar med pa ni gzhan gyis gzung ba'i bud med la rab tu sbyar bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos 'dir rang dbar med pa ni gzhan gyis gzung ba'i bud med la rab tu sbyar bar mi bya'o //
translated: The adept should not apply here to a woman held by another.

original: rgyal srid sgrub pa mchog ni nges pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal srid sgrub pa mchog ni nges pa ste //
translated: The supreme attainment of kingship is certain.

original: 'dir sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas par bya'o zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas par bya'o zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Here the king of mantras should be recited. This is the meaning.

original: sgrub pa po gang gis slar yang gzhan du ste gzhan gyis bdag tu bzung ba'i bud med sgrub pa ni 'dod pa la longs spyod cing 'dod pa la chags pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po gang gis slar yang gzhan du ste gzhan gyis bdag tu bzung ba'i bud med sgrub pa ni 'dod pa la longs spyod cing 'dod pa la chags pa ste /
translated: The adept who again elsewhere, that is, in another place, attains a woman held by another, enjoys desire, is attached to desire.

original: des de bzhin du dbang byas pas lhung bar 'gyur te sdig par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: des de bzhin du dbang byas pas lhung bar 'gyur te sdig par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
translated: By being controlled by him in that way, he will fall, that is, he will be sinful. This is the meaning.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir na de gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i bud med bsgrubs na 'od mi nus pa'i phyir de'i skad cig la 'chi bar 'gyur te de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir na de gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba'i bud med bsgrubs na 'od mi nus pa'i phyir de'i skad cig la 'chi bar 'gyur te de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For what reason? Because he is unable to attain a woman held by another, he will die at that moment, because he does not see her.

original: gal te lha'i bu mo yin yang 'dir the tshom med do zhes pa ni lha'i bu mo yang nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: gal te lha'i bu mo yin yang 'dir the tshom med do zhes pa ni lha'i bu mo yang nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
translated: If it is a celestial maiden, there is no doubt here. This means that even a celestial maiden will certainly come.

original: rigs kyi 'jig rten mgon po'i lnga bcu pa las lha'i de kho na nyid rim par phye ba ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: rigs kyi 'jig rten mgon po'i lnga bcu pa las lha'i de kho na nyid rim par phye ba ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter on the sequence of the reality of the gods in the noble Lokanātha’s Fifty Verses.

original: // / yang dag srung zhes pa la sogs pa ni de rnal 'byor pas dam tshig spyod pa dman pas 'dren pa'i sngags nyid bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: // / yang dag srung zhes pa la sogs pa ni de rnal 'byor pas dam tshig spyod pa dman pas 'dren pa'i sngags nyid bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Correctly protected” and so forth. The mantra itself should be recited by the yogī who practices the vow, who is of low status.

original: sba zhing srog bzhin bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: sba zhing srog bzhin bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: It should be concealed and protected as one’s life.

original: 'dir sngags ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi snying po'o//
analyzed: 'dir sngags ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi snying po'o//
translated: Here, the mantra is the essence of Lokeśvara.

original: @194a * // mchog ni phul du byung pa'o //🔽gcig pu grogs dang bral byas te //
analyzed: @194a * // mchog ni phul du byung pa'o // gcig pu grogs dang bral byas te //
translated: “Supreme” means excellent.

original: zhes pa la sogs bzhi rnal 'byor pas gang gi tshe sngags zlos par byed pa de'i tshe gcig pu ni gnas kyi don thams cad la chags pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs bzhi rnal 'byor pas gang gi tshe sngags zlos par byed pa de'i tshe gcig pu ni gnas kyi don thams cad la chags pa spangs pa'o //
translated: “Alone, free from companions,” and so forth. When the yogī recites the mantra, at that time alone means abandoning attachment to all the meanings of the abode.

original: 'bum dang ldan ni 'bum phrag gsum gyi grangs kyi sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bum dang ldan ni 'bum phrag gsum gyi grangs kyi sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The hundred-thousand is the recitation of the mantra three hundred thousand times.

original: de yang 'khor lo gsum ste sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'khor lo gsum ste sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: And that is the three wheels, the characteristics of body, speech, and mind.

original: bde gshegs mngon sum zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: bde gshegs mngon sum zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The manifest Sugata is the meaning of will manifest body, speech, and mind.

original: da ni sngags bzlas pa'i 'bras bu'i bdag nyid chen por gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sngags bzlas pa'i 'bras bu'i bdag nyid chen por gsungs te /
translated: Now the greatness of the result of mantra recitation is stated:

original: 'jig rten thams cad 'byin pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa ni gang sngon du gsungs pa'i chos gsang sngags bzlas pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa des 'jig rten thams cad skad cig tsam la de bzhin du 'byin par byed pa dang skad cig tsam la de bzhin du sdud par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad 'byin pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa ni gang sngon du gsungs pa'i chos gsang sngags bzlas pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa des 'jig rten thams cad skad cig tsam la de bzhin du 'byin par byed pa dang skad cig tsam la de bzhin du sdud par byed de /
translated: The emanation of all worlds and so forth is that the yogi who possesses the mantra recitation of the secret Dharma previously stated emanates all worlds in an instant and in that way collects them in an instant.

original: yang nas yang du 'byin pa dang sdud par byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: yang nas yang du 'byin pa dang sdud par byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that he has the ability to emanate and collect again and again.

original: nam mkha'i go 'phang 'gro zhes pa ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed pa ni phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa ste rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i go 'phang 'gro zhes pa ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed pa ni phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa ste rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase going to the state of space means that those who go to space are Vajrapāṇi and so forth, who possess magical powers.

original: de rnams kyi go 'phang ni de dag gi gnas su 'gro ba ste sgrib pa dang bral ba'i gnas su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: de rnams kyi go 'phang ni de dag gi gnas su 'gro ba ste sgrib pa dang bral ba'i gnas su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: Their state is going to their abode, which means going to the state free from obscurations.

original: dran pas 'di la the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: dran pas 'di la the tshom med pa'o //
translated: One should have no doubt about this through mindfulness.

original: da ni pha rol gyi grong du 'jug pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni pha rol gyi grong du 'jug pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the entry into the city of the other should be explained.

original: sems dang sems med sbyor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni sems ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems med sbyor ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni sems ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase the union of mind and no-mind and so forth. Mind is the consciousness of the practitioner.

original: lus skyes ni lus las skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen por gyur pa rnams 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus skyes ni lus las skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen por gyur pa rnams 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: The body-born ones are those who cause the great elements that arise from the body to enter.

original: gang la sems med pa ni ro'i lus so //
analyzed: gang la sems med pa ni ro'i lus so //
translated: That which is without mind is the body of a corpse.

original: sbyor ba ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: Union is entry.

original: sems ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa sems med pa'i ro'i lus la yang dag par thim pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa sems med pa'i ro'i lus la yang dag par thim pa'o //
translated: The mind is the consciousness of the practitioner, which dissolves into the body of a corpse without mind.

original: lus skyes mang po rnams la rab tu zhugs nas sems ni sems las nges par mthong ste /
analyzed: lus skyes mang po rnams la rab tu zhugs nas sems ni sems las nges par mthong ste /
translated: Having entered into the many bodies born from the body, the mind is seen to be definitely in the mind.

original: ro'i lus la sems de bzhin du 'dir sems dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: ro'i lus la sems de bzhin du 'dir sems dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The mind in the body of the corpse is likewise here with the mind.

original: nges par mthong ba ni ro de la nges par mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: nges par mthong ba ni ro de la nges par mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Seeing definitely means that it will be seen definitely in the corpse.

original: 'dir tshogs pa'i don ni sems can thams cad kyi srog gi gzugs sems kyi rten du gyur pa de nyid rim pas pha rol gyi grong la 'jug pa'i dus su rnal 'byor pas steng du blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir tshogs pa'i don ni sems can thams cad kyi srog gi gzugs sems kyi rten du gyur pa de nyid rim pas pha rol gyi grong la 'jug pa'i dus su rnal 'byor pas steng du blang bar bya ste /
translated: Here the meaning of the assembly is that the life of all sentient beings, the form of the mind, which has become the support of the mind, is that very thing which, in stages, enters the city of the other at the time of entering. The yogi should take it up above.

original: ji srid lte ba'i 'og nas de yang steng du mgrin pa'i phyogs kyi mthar thug pa bkang nas @194b sna'i bug nas 'thon te ro mnyam pa'i lus la yang dag par zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid lte ba'i 'og nas de yang steng du mgrin pa'i phyogs kyi mthar thug pa bkang nas @194b sna'i bug nas 'thon te ro mnyam pa'i lus la yang dag par zhugs par bya'o //
translated: As long as it is filled from below the navel up to the end of the throat above, it should come out of the nostrils and enter the body of the same taste.

original: ji srid ro'i lus g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: ji srid ro'i lus g-yo ba ste /
translated: As long as the body of the corpse moves,

original: sbal pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: sbal pa bzhin du'o //
translated: like a snake.

original: ci'i phyir yang rab tu g-yo ba na slar yang de las ro'i lus la myur du srog tshur dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rab tu g-yo ba na slar yang de las ro'i lus la myur du srog tshur dgug par bya'o //
translated: If it moves again, one should quickly draw in the life-breath into the body of the flavor[-mantra].

original: de bzhin du pha rol gyi grong du 'jug pa la goms par bya'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol gyi grong du 'jug pa la goms par bya'o /
translated: In the same way, one should practice entering the city of others.

original: // / da ni sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi che ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi che ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the greatness of the nature of the mantra is to be explained.

original: nad bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nad bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The line with disease and so on means with disease.

original: nad med ni nad las nges par grol par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nad med ni nad las nges par grol par byed pa'o //
translated: The line without disease means freed from disease.

original: de bzhin du nad med pa yang bde ba dang bcas par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nad med pa yang bde ba dang bcas par byed do //
translated: In the same way, without disease means with happiness.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi rgyal po'i dbang pos byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi rgyal po'i dbang pos byed de /
translated: In the same way, the king of mantras does it.

original: zhags pa lcags kyus 'dzin pa zhes pa 'di'i zhags pa lcags kyus 'dzin pa'i tshig brling pa ni sngon bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhags pa lcags kyus 'dzin pa zhes pa 'di'i zhags pa lcags kyus 'dzin pa'i tshig brling pa ni sngon bshad zin to //
translated: The line with the hook of the noose means that the meaning of with the hook of the noose has been explained before.

original: gzhan du zhes pa la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba sngon du gsungs pa'i cho ga ma yin pa gang gi las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas sgrub pa de ni gzhan du ste byis pa rmongs pas zla ba 'dzin par 'dod pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes pa la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba sngon du gsungs pa'i cho ga ma yin pa gang gi las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas sgrub pa de ni gzhan du ste byis pa rmongs pas zla ba 'dzin par 'dod pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: “Otherwise” and so on: any practice that follows the rite of the procedure previously stated, but not by nature, is “otherwise,” like a deluded child who wishes to grasp the moon.

original: gsum gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa po gang gis 'jig rten mgon po'i sku gsum gsum du rig pa ste /
analyzed: gsum gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa po gang gis 'jig rten mgon po'i sku gsum gsum du rig pa ste /
translated: “ Three by three” and so on: any practitioner who knows the three bodies of the Lord of the World,

original: gsum ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gsum ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: “three” means “threefold.”

original: de las de nyid gsum ni sngags kyi de nyid dang / bdag gi de nyid dang / lha'i de nyid do //
analyzed: de las de nyid gsum ni sngags kyi de nyid dang / bdag gi de nyid dang / lha'i de nyid do //
translated: From that, the three realities are the reality of mantra, the reality of the self, and the reality of the deity.

original: gzhan yang gsum ni sku gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ni sku gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, the three are the three bodies.

original: chos dang // longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sbrul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: chos dang // longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sbrul pa'i sku'o //
translated: They are the Dharma body, the enjoyment body, and the emanation body.

original: gzhan yang sku gsum gsum ni yi ge rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sku gsum gsum ni yi ge rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, the three bodies are the three syllables.

original: de bzhin du gsum gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should know the three by three.

original: gnas skabs gsum ni zhi ba dang / gnyis su med pa dang / lam rnam par sbyang ba'i ye shes kyi skabs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum ni zhi ba dang / gnyis su med pa dang / lam rnam par sbyang ba'i ye shes kyi skabs so //
translated: The three occasions are the occasion of peace, the occasion of non-duality, and the occasion of the wisdom that purifies the path.

original: de bzhin du sku gsum dang gnas skabs gsum ni 'jig rten mgon po'i go 'phang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsum dang gnas skabs gsum ni 'jig rten mgon po'i go 'phang ste /
translated: Likewise, the three bodies and the three occasions are the state of the Lokanatha.

original: 'jig rten mgon po'i rang bzhin du sgrub pa po gang gis shes pa des nges par 'jig rten mgon po'i go 'phang du 'gro'o zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po'i rang bzhin du sgrub pa po gang gis shes pa des nges par 'jig rten mgon po'i go 'phang du 'gro'o zhes pa'i don no //
